issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: DNS TCP handler logs maximum size error

comments.body: id add that the max length is protocol specific.  512 for udp and 65535 for tcp, iirc.
Clients have been able to request fragmented responses over UDP since 1999.  This makes it possible to respond to DNSSEC-enabled queries without driving server load through the roof.
When this is fixed make sure the size is truly configurable

To make sure I am understanding what is required her,
1) Make sure the error is only logged for messages that are actually too large and not processed?
2) Make sure DNSProperties.MAX_MESSAGE_SIZE is configurable?
[~mmunn1], the issue was opened as we currently log that the message is ignored but continue to process it.
[~sjones] So for this issue all  we want to do is actually ignore the request if it is larger than 1024 bytes.

[~mmunn1] if 1024 is too small we should change the default setting and probably put something in the release notes. If the maximum size property is not useful we could simply remove it. [~spark] or [~decker] may be able to provide guidance.
[~spark] , [~decker]  What exactly do we want to do here, see Steves comments above.
[~sjones] , [~spark] , [~decker] I believe that removing the check is the way to go as this will not change the current behavior or require release note changes . Any thoughts?

Code Review Request : EUCA-6427 DNS TCP handler logs maximum size error 	

branch : dev/mmunn1/EUCA-6427

diff :  git show --color bedbbf48c5a64d652272cb9488dbfae70196baf2

Summary: The DNS TCP handler currently checks the message size and logs an error for messages larger than 1024 bytes.
         We have decided that this unnecessary may cause a problem if people queries with over 1k data.

Solution: Remove the check for DNSProperties.MAX_MESSAGE_SIZE 

Unit test : use "nc" to open a TCP connection to the DNS service and send message that exceeds 1024 bytes
            and check for unwanted error. i.e. "nc  hostName  53 <  fileLargerThan1024"
            
I have created testcase ./eutester/testcases/cloud_admin/4.0/Euca6427
[~spark], inputLength is read as an unsigned short (readUnsignedShort) so the maximum size is 65535.
[~mmunn1][~sjones] I think then the fix is good.

No longer seeing this when running the following:
[root@g-15-08 ~]# dd if=/dev/urandom bs=1M of=testfile
^C11+1 records in
11+0 records out
11534336 bytes (12 MB) copied, 6.70814 s, 1.7 MB/s

[root@g-15-08 ~]# nc 10.111.5.163 53 < testfile

[root@g-15-08 ~]#
